citations.narrative:
The facility is currently housing a rabbit with another species in the same primary enclosure. Housing rabbits with
other species may affect their health and well-being and increase their risk of injury.
A system should be in place and maintained to ensure rabbits are not housed in the same primary enclosure with
any
other species.
Correct by 04/28/2016.
Exit interview was conducted with facility representative, Jean Bolinger, CS and Tyler Fields, VMO.
Additional Inspectors
Bolinger Jean, Compliance Specialist

narrative:
3.58(a)
CLASSIFICATION AND SEPARATION. 
The facility is currently housing a rabbit with another species in the same primary enclosure.  Housing rabbits with
other species may affect their health and well-being and increase their risk of injury.
A system should be in place and maintained to ensure rabbits are not housed in the same primary enclosure with
any
other species.
Correct by 04/28/2016.
Exit interview was conducted with facility representative, Jean Bolinger, CS and Tyler Fields, VMO.
